hero.title: Why AI Needs Human Logic to Be Truly Useful
hero.subtitle: As artificial intelligence integrates into more business processes, a recurring question arises: will AI replace people?
hero.intro: In practice, the most successful cases demonstrate the opposite. AI generates value when it complements human reasoning, not when it attempts to substitute it.

whyAiNotEnough.title: Why AI alone is not enough
content: AI is excellent at processing data, but lacks:
The Stanford Human-Centered AI Institute points out that AI systems should be designed to augment human decision-making. [1]

humanLogicControl.title: Human logic as a control layer
content: The OECD AI Policy Observatory emphasizes the need for human oversight in regulated sectors. [2]

aiInProcesses.title: Useful AI lives within processes
content: AI adds value when integrated into existing flows. Research from MIT Sloan Management Review shows that the best results come from hybrid AI + human models. [3]

exampleLegalHelpAi.title: Applied Example: LegalHelp AI
exampleLegalHelpAi.content: LegalHelp AI, within the DocumentoIQ ecosystem, applies AI to legal document processing by:

extract.title: Data Extraction
extract.description: Extracting structured data from complex documents.

review.title: Review and Validation
review.description: Allowing professionals to review and validate results.

exampleLegalHelpAi.conclusion: AI accelerates document analysis, while human professionals remain responsible for interpretation and decisions. The system is designed to back logic, not replace it, highlighting key information and allowing mandatory human review. AI accelerates analysis; the professional maintains control.

strategicImplications.title: Strategic Implications
content: • AI must be designed with human oversight
The World Economic Forum backs this approach in its work on responsible AI. [4]

finalConclusion.title: Conclusion
content: AI does not replace human logic: it needs it. The most effective systems are those that strengthen professional reasoning and improve real processes responsibly.
